greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of Lyndon compositions of n where every pair of adjacent parts (including the last with the first) is relatively prime.
comment: A Lyndon composition of n is a finite sequence of positive integers summing to n that is lexicographically strictly less than all of its cyclic rotations.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(8) = 18 Lyndon compositions (empty column not shown):
program: b(n, q, pred)={my(M=matrix(n, n)); for(k=1, n, M[k, k]=pred(q, k); for(i=1, k-1, M[i, k]=sum(j=1, k-i, if(pred(j, i), M[j, k-i], 0)))); M[q, ]}
seq(n)={my(v=sum(k=1, n, k*b(n, k, (i, j)->gcd(i, j)==1))); vector(n, n, sumdiv(n, d, moebius(d)*v[n/d])/n)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 01 2019
xref: The non-Lyndon version is A328609 or A318748 (with singletons).
The non-Lyndon non-circular version is A167606.
The version with singletons is A318745.
The necklace case is A328597 or A318728 (with singletons).
Lyndon compositions are A059966, with relatively prime case A318731.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 26 2019
